Projects

Research Implementation

Published research projects with full codebase availability. Each implementation demonstrates novel methodologies in safe reinforcement learning, human-robot interaction, and optimization-based control systems.

Featured Projects

Safe Reinforcement Learning for Human–Robot Shared Control

Research Implementation
Python • PyTorch • Safe RL (CPO, PPO-Lagrangian, SAC-Lagrangian) • Shared-Control Robotics 2024

A comprehensive benchmarking framework for Safe Reinforcement Learning in human–robot shared control. The project systematically evaluates advanced Safe RL algorithms and classical control baselines across diverse robot platforms, human behaviour models, and safety constraints, producing publication-ready results for robotics and RL venues.

Research Contributions:

  • End-to-end benchmarking pipeline for state-of-the-art Safe RL and classical control methods in shared-control tasks.
  • Rich suite of performance, safety, and human-centric metrics (success, constraint violations, trust, workload, etc.).
  • Built-in statistical analysis with hypothesis tests, effect sizes, bootstrap confidence intervals, and power analysis.
  • Cross-domain evaluation across manipulators, mobile bases, humanoids, and collaborative assembly scenarios.
  • Ablation-study tools for understanding algorithm components, failure modes, and generalisation behaviour.

Technical Implementation:

  • Structured src/ layout with baselines, evaluation, analysis, utils, and experiments modules.
  • Implementations of multiple Safe RL algorithms (SAC-Lagrangian, TD3-Constrained, PPO-Lagrangian, CPO variants) plus MPC, LQR, PID, impedance, and admittance controllers.
  • EvaluationSuite and experiment runners that orchestrate large-scale experiments with multiple seeds and environments.
  • Automatic generation of publication materials: comparison plots, safety heatmaps, LaTeX tables, and reports.
  • Reproducibility management with deterministic seeds, system logging, profiling, and experiment tracking utilities.
View Code Documentation Research Paper

Model-Based RL for Predictive Human Intent Recognition

Project Ready
Python • Model Predictive Control (MPC) • Bayesian Reinforcement Learning • Human–Robot Interaction 2024

A research framework that models human behaviour and infers intent to enable anticipatory human–robot collaboration. The system combines model-based prediction of human motion with Bayesian RL and MPC, allowing a robot to plan safe, cooperative actions under uncertainty about human goals and future trajectories.

Research Contributions:

  • Unified architecture for behaviour modelling, intent prediction, control, and learning in human–robot interaction.
  • Abstract interfaces for human behaviour models and intent predictors, enabling plug-and-play comparison of different algorithms.
  • Uncertainty-aware decision making via Bayesian RL, supporting safer exploration around humans.
  • MPC formulation that integrates human motion and intent forecasts into the robot's optimisation problem.
  • Clear separation between human state representation, prediction, and robot control for reusable, extensible research code.

Technical Implementation:

  • Modular Python package with models/, controllers/, agents/, utils/, and visualization/ subsystems.
  • Type-hinted, test-driven codebase with unit, integration, and fixture-based tests using pytest.
  • Configurable MPC horizon, safety margins, and workspace bounds via .env and config files.
  • Logging, experiment management, and trajectory visualisation tools for analysing controller behaviour.
  • Automated style, lint, and type checks using Black, Flake8, and MyPy for research-grade software quality.
View Code Documentation

HealthBot Chat Assistant

Production Ready
Python • Streamlit • Google Gemini API • Responsible AI • Health Information Chatbot 2024

An AI-powered health information assistant that guides users through symptom descriptions and follow-up questions while enforcing strict non-diagnostic boundaries. The system structures responses into possible conditions, causes, lifestyle advice, and doctor-visit guidance, with built-in safety disclaimers and conversation memory.

Research Contributions:

  • Design of a non-diagnostic conversational health assistant focused on clarity and safety rather than medical decision-making.
  • Prompt and response structure that consistently surfaces symptoms, causes, remedies, prevention, and consultation advice.
  • Explicit safety guardrails through mandatory disclaimers and scoped prompts, aligned with responsible AI principles.
  • Memory-aware dialogue flow that maintains context across turns to produce more coherent health guidance.
  • Serve-as-a-blueprint for lightweight, auditable health chatbots that can be extended with verification or RAG.

Technical Implementation:

  • Single-page Streamlit UI with structured symptom input, expandable sections, and chat-style history.
  • Integration with Google's Gemini API using google-generativeai and secure key management via .env.
  • Clear project layout with minimal dependencies for fast deployment on Streamlit Cloud or similar platforms.
  • Conversation reset, session state handling, and formatted markdown responses for improved user experience.
  • Open-source implementation under MIT license for reuse in teaching, demos, and further research.
View Code Documentation Live Demo

Titanic Survival Prediction Model

Project Complete
Python • Scikit-learn • Feature Engineering • Binary Classification • Kaggle Titanic Dataset 2024

A classical machine learning pipeline that predicts passenger survival on the Titanic using engineered demographic and ticket-related features. The project demonstrates end-to-end supervised learning—from data preprocessing to model training, evaluation, and batch prediction—on a well-known benchmark dataset.

Research Contributions:

  • Exploration of tabular feature engineering (titles, family size, deck, ticket prefixes) to improve predictive power.
  • Comparative study of Logistic Regression vs Random Forest, highlighting trade-offs between interpretability and accuracy.
  • Cross-validated evaluation with typical performance of ~80–85% accuracy and ~0.85–0.90 ROC AUC.
  • Design of a reusable prediction pipeline for batch inference on new passenger manifests.
  • Clean example of how to structure a small ML project for teaching and portfolio demonstration.

Technical Implementation:

  • Modular src/ scripts for feature engineering (features.py), training (train.py), and prediction (predict.py).
  • Command-line interface for training with custom CSVs, test splits, and model output paths.
  • Model persistence using Joblib, enabling fast loading and deployment of the best-performing model.
  • Input/output CSV specification with additional Survival_Prob and Survival_Pred columns for downstream use.
  • Lightweight dependency stack (NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn) suitable for quick experimentation on any machine.
View Code Documentation

Typing Speed Test Application

Project Complete
Python • Tkinter GUI • HCI • Educational Tool 2024

A desktop application that trains and evaluates users' typing speed and accuracy through staged practice with sentences and paragraphs. The tool offers multiple difficulty paths, real-time feedback, and progress tracking, turning typing practice into a structured, data-driven learning experience.

Research Contributions:

  • Multi-stage training design with short sentences, long sentences, paragraphs, and timed tests to gradually increase difficulty.
  • Flexible user journey that supports different starting points (sentences vs paragraphs) while explaining the full stage structure.
  • Rich feedback on words per minute, accuracy, and progress, helping users monitor improvement over time.
  • Carefully designed interaction logic that encourages correction of mistakes without enforcing perfection.
  • Practical example of a small-scale HCI/education tool showcasing interface design and user-centric logic.

Technical Implementation:

  • Tkinter-based GUI with custom dialogs for mode selection, stage explanation, and result pop-ups.
  • Real-time color-coded feedback (green/red) as users type, plus timers for timed paragraphs.
  • Progress tracker displayed on the interface, including stage and sentence counters.
  • Protection against copy-paste and right-click to ensure genuine typing practice.
  • Text resources organised in external files (sentences.txt, long_sentences.txt, paragraphs.txt) for easy extension.
